publishedfiledetails.title: Bugpatch
publishedfiledetails.file_description: TLDR: Patches many bug xenos to have more genes. As well as adds a new xenotype for big & small xeno hive based on the insectophage (sorta) This mod was inspired by Insect genes to Insect Xenos and was partly made using Custom Xenotype Exporter Tool I'll add the gene additions in full later, but many are cosmetic (skin/hair) and others are abilities I feel fits or inheritance related. The mod also patches 3 xenos to spawnin the big and small xeno hive, those are the insector, insectophage, and my custom xeno that's included. This is my first ever mod so please don't expect it to be without issues. I also may or may not change the genes and add/remove to this mod, as this is more for my personal taste for playing but thought others may enjoy. If any mod author I have included a patch for would like me to take this down, please let me know. This mod changes: Alpha Genes - Hiveling Big & Small - Devilspider, Hive Queen, Weaver, Xeno Hive Insectophage Oops All Bugparts 2 - Arachna, Lunarians, Mantids VRE Insector

publishedfiledetails.title: Helpful Pals _zh
publishedfiledetails.file_description: 原模組是個基於幻獸帕魯所製作的動物模組，本模組的動物，也就是怕魯，也會基於原作那樣，會依據其自身特性與能力，可以為殖民地進行一些特定的工作。 例如：波霸牛能產出牛奶，搗蛋貓、棉悠悠、融焰娘會幫忙搬運跟清潔，但搗蛋貓還會挖礦， 而融焰娘也還會幫火把跟營火填充燃料以外、也會烹飪食物(但要注意牠煮的東西可能會導致食物中毒)， 灌木羊則會種植跟產出莓果， 不過有些工作必須要先經過培訓才會。 而且從敘述上來看，原作有的屬性跟會的工作似乎都會有些對應 像是電系帕魯會幫電池充電、火系帕魯會幫火把跟營火添加燃料等 還有一些帕魯(例如：融焰娘和白絨雪怪)會有影響室溫的特性，也需要注意規劃。 另外原模組的作者不會加入全部的帕魯，而是作者有靈感且想要加入時，才會慢慢增加，但也可以為此增加擴充或擴展的模組。 本次翻譯用上的機翻和AI的次數不算多，頂多需要分析整理一下，然後還是嘗試自身校閱跟腦補，還有大部分的文本都可從原版邊緣世界和幻獸帕魯裡頭找到，像是部位的文本、蛋的文本、和官方名稱與文本等。 繁轉簡一樣用ConvertZZ進行轉換，所以用語可能會有些不同，不過我印象中帕魯的官方用語部分，似乎是一樣的。

publishedfiledetails.file_description: ——简体汉化,不喜勿喷 Keep Converting的汉化 模组简单介绍： 当你使用传教者的“教化”能力来减少囚犯文化认可度,却在每次教化冷却结束忘记接着教化.等你想起来的时候,囚犯认可度又涨回来了. 觉得眼熟?这样的场景,此时此刻正在殖民地各处上演.下一个可能就是你.除非你能做出生命中最重要的选择 有了这个mod,你可以为你的传教者设定一个目标自动教化,直到目标被成功教化，或者无法教化（例如，死亡，离开地图等）。 (P.S:AlertUtility这个mod可以定闹钟提醒你作为平替)

publishedfiledetails.title: [TTV] Sylel Plushie and Statue [1.4 - 1.5]
publishedfiledetails.file_description: The one and only plushie mod you'll ever need! Made as a gift to twitch.tv/magical_bard during one of his Medieval Overhaul RimWorld streams. This mod is quite simple and straightforward. It adds 2 variants (default and painted) of statues of Sylel that act similar to sculptures that can be crafted with 100x stone blocks (marble, limestone, etc.) and can be found under the Misc tab in the Architect menu. Additionally, it adds a Sylel plushie that can be crafted with 40x fabric (cloth, devilstrand, etc.) and is intended for decoration and (if you have Hospitality in your modpack) as a sellable item for guests. To craft a Sylel "Truth" Castex statue, you'll need to have Complex Furniture researched. To craft a Sylel "Truth" Castex plushie, you'll need to have Complex Clothing researched. If you have any suggestions for improvements or need help with bug-fixing, feel free to send me a DM on Discord at @lunarinna. This is my first mod, so be aware of possible conflicts with other mods! As always, it's highly advised to backup your local saves and mods.

publishedfiledetails.title: Medieval Things: Geysers
publishedfiledetails.file_description: In a medieval colony, the limited steam geysers aren't as valuable as they are in a typical playthrough. This mod aims to restore that value by expanding the functionality of geysers through geothermal crafting. It introduces a series of handcrafted, stone-built workstations—each designed to function independently, but gaining powerful bonuses when placed adjacent to a Geyser Core. From smithing and brewing to crystal generation and arcane forges, every structure is fireproof, fuel-efficient, and deeply rooted in ancient stonecraft. Features: • New geothermal-compatible workbenches with unique roles and bonuses • The Geyser Core - a central module that distributes heat, light, fuel, and speed boosts • Fully medieval-compatible, with immersive aesthetics and balanced progression Additional mod support: • A RimWorld of Magic - Unlocks the Magicyte Harvester • VFE Medieval 2 - Draught Lab receives bonuses from the Geyser Core • Medieval Overhaul - Stone Oven, Large Stone Oven, and Furnace bonuses from the Geyser Core Craft with stone. Power with steam. Build the forgotten technologies of a deeper age. --- Q&A Q: Can this be added mid game? A: Yes, its safe to add in an already playthrough. Q: Can this be removed mid game? A: If you delete all related buildings, should be safe to remove. I am mainly do medieval runs so if you are medieval player as well and want to help support me make more mods, subscribe to my Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/Salvador143

publishedfiledetails.title: RimPikmin
publishedfiledetails.file_description: https://i.imgur.com/cR7bs1o.png Bring the charm and strategy of Pikmin into RimWorld! This mod introduces fully functional Pikmin as plant-based helpers who grow from adaptive seeds into unique, specialized helpers, each color representing a unique role. Whether for hauling, combat, exploration, or morale, Pikmin offer a lively and powerful addition to your colony’s survival story. The Official Discord Server: https://discord.gg/SKa8G5vMBS https://i.imgur.com/1durOK1.png You can only have 100 active pikmin at a time, but that doesn't mean you can't get more *Winking face* https://i.imgur.com/oiGdHtK.png These are small creatures that can carry a stack of 2 for each Pikmin. A Purple Pikmin can carry much more, plus items, chunks, etc! https://i.imgur.com/B0yTPQN.png The Pikmin can be drafted to attack, move, or any of their specific jobs. https://i.imgur.com/uTOBV5j.png https://i.imgur.com/vgOf2lI.png https://i.imgur.com/uaSEixo.png In order for Pikmin to be active they need their home, the Onion, or they won't come out. https://i.imgur.com/NB8Yply.png Every night, the Pikmin (except Glow Pikmin) will start heading to the Onion for rest till the next sunny day. So don't be surprised if they get drafted and stop being drafted after a few seconds. https://i.imgur.com/LBrrSPA.png https://i.imgur.com/CFfvzn9.png Since there can only be up to 100 Pikmin, what if someone wants to have all Purple Pikmin or switch to all Yellow Pikmin? You can access the Onion Trade UI screen to remove or add all the Pikmin you want replacing. https://i.imgur.com/O0ecl4a.png Colonists can bond with Pikmin, improving their modd and work efficiency when Pikmin are nearby. https://i.imgur.com/tumE1o7.png https://i.imgur.com/6RrFVGx.png Check out the awesome RimPikmin Style mod. Monsters from the game is in the works. https://i.imgur.com/YT4KDdy.jpeg https://i.imgur.com/C0s7Yml.jpeg https://i.imgur.com/6n2naAI.png Taranchuk - Coding Gerrymon - Artwork & Info-graphics Ogam - Artwork If you want to help fund this project. Currently working on Monsters next. https://i.imgur.com/ZHOIneO.png

publishedfiledetails.title: Automatic Work Assignment
publishedfiledetails.file_description: Why hello there! Are you someone just like me who hates doing manual work, but love spending significantly longer automating the same work? Then this might just be the mod for you! This mod adds a new Work Manager tab, that allows you to specify a number of work specifications to be automatically assigned to your colonists. Each work specification has its own fully customizable fitness functions used to prioritize who is assigned to it, as well as the conditions that must be met for assignment. You can even choose to have certain actions performed when the work is assigned to a pawn! The ultimate goal of this, is to be able to fully automate the work assignments of all your pawns, with no need to exclude any. Though, you can still do so if you really need to. This mod is freshly released, and may contain major bugs. If you run into an issue seemingly caused by this mod, let me know and I'll look into it as soon as possible. I have tested the mod a fair amount, but there is always a risk of oversights. Quick info There shouldn't be any mod incompatibilities. You can safely add this to a save. You should be able to safely remove this from a save. Let me know in the comments if you have any issues. Source: https://github.com/Lomztein/RW-AutomaticWorkAssignment Introduction You'll find this tab right next to where you usually find your work tab. When you open it, you'll see a window composed of four major sections: Work Specification List Here you see a list of work specifications. The order of these determines which will be assigned to colonists first. You can, of course, reorder them as you please. Reordering this list is currently a bit of a pain with large lists. I plan to look into the ability to drag the specifications, though for the moment you can hold shift while clicking the reordering buttons, and this will (sometimes, it's temperamental) move specifications all the way to the top or bottom. At the bottom of this list there are four buttons you use to do the following: Resolve pawn assignments now. Automatically resolve assignments each day. Exclude certain pawns from assignments. Not yet implemented, no promises but I'd like for this to allow you to import and export configurations. Basics The top half of the middle section is where you can change the basic information of the work specification. The options are as follows. Name: Just a label, doesn't have any impact other than organization. Min (workers): The minimum number workers. If not enough workers that meet the condition are available to meet this threshold, then conditions will be ignored until enough workers has been assigned. Target (workers): The target number of workers, or how many pawns should be assigned to this work. Critical: Pawns with critical work that are downed, will immediately be substituted by someone else if the number of workers fall below the minimum. incremental: Designates the work specification to be incrementally assigned to pawns, over multiple iterations. Useful for less critical works. Commitment: Estimate of how much of time is commited to this work, used to avoid over-comitting highly talented pawns. Priorities The bottom half of the middle section is the priorities. Add the jobs you wish done for this work to this list, ordered by priority. The assignment algorithm will assign priorities to pawns in the order you define here. Settings This is where you define how your pawns should be prioritized, what conditions must be met for a pawn to be assigned, and what tasks should run on assignment. This section is composed of three subsections. Fitness Here you define the fitness functions to be used to prioritize which pawns will be assigned to work. This cascades, so that functions further down the list act as 'tie breakers' for functions further up the list. For example, if you have the 'Learning rate' function at the top, and 'Skill level' below that, it will prioritize all pawns with the highest learning rate first, and of those it will prioritize those with highest skill level. Conditions This defines a set of conditions that must be met for a pawn to be assigned to the work, such as minimum or maximum skill levels, certain genes, passions. If you have any mod that allows your colonists to train, this can be used to automatically assign pawns with passions, and below a set skill level, to train that skill. Conditions are ignored if an insufficient amount of workers that meet them are ignored for the minimal amount of workers. On Assignment This allows you to execute certain actions when a pawn is assigned the work, such as restricting apparel, drugs, or areas. Alternative mods If this is all way more complicated than what you need, I can easily recommend any of these mods as alternatives. Automated Work Assignment: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3453406362 AutoPriorities https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1598406574 I have used both of these with decent success on large colonies, and they are both excellent solutions if you're looking for something more "fire and forget". TODO The current library of fitness functions, conditions, and on-assignment tasks are just what I've been able to come up with during development. More can added at request, or if you're feeling up for it, by other mods. The system is designed to be easily extensible. To implement a new fitness function, you just create a new class that implements the IPawnFitness interface, create a PawnSettingDef, and provide a PawnSettingUIHandler object. Check out the source code if you're feeling brave. (Fair warning, it was written largely over a weekend binge, enter at your own risk.) I plan to extend the library over time, including integrating features from other mods, such as setting Combat Extended loadouts. There is still a lot of room for improvements, in particular regarding quality-of-life features for the UI. You can't currently use this with multiple colonies, as the automation is global. I plan to change this later down the line.

publishedfiledetails.title: [Sub_mod]Vanilla Factions Expanded - Medieval 2  [PL]
publishedfiledetails.file_description: "Godny następca naszych ukochanych Vanilla Factions Expanded - Medieval i Vanilla Factions Expanded - Vikings, VFE-Medieval 2 bazuje na wszystkim, co czyniło oryginały świetnymi. Chociaż nie jest to średniowieczny remont, który usuwa zawartość z późnej fazy gry na rzecz zawartości średniowiecznej, starannie zaprojektowaliśmy go tak, aby płynnie wypełnić lukę między epoką neolitu i epoką przemysłową, zapewniając, że średniowieczne technologie pozostaną aktualne nawet w miarę postępów. Oto, czego możesz się spodziewać: - Nowe średniowieczne frakcje i wojny: Spotkaj ufortyfikowane zamki, miasta wikingów i karawany kupców. Weź udział w oblężeniach i potyczkach zamków, a także handluj! - Znacząca średniowieczna technologia: Odblokuj średniowieczne postępy, które nie staną się przestarzałe: broń palna z zamkiem lontowym, alchemia i potężne fortyfikacje, które pozostają przydatne aż do ery przemysłowej. - Nowa gospodarka i przemysł: Produkuj wyborne wina, bogaty miód i wytwarzaj zbroje, tworząc kwitnącą gospodarkę średniowieczną, która wspiera zarówno handel, jak i wojnę. - Rozszerzone rzemiosło i wyposażenie: Używaj rozszerzonego arsenału średniowiecznej broni, od łuków wojennych i kusz po halabardy i piki o zwiększonym zasięgu ataku, i ubierz swoich wojowników i bazę w niestandardowe heraldyczne stroje i struktury, prezentując kolory swojej frakcji. - Wymagający gawędziarz - Maynard Medieval: Gawędziarz, który akceptuje dramat, cierpienie i powolny postęp technologiczny, zmuszając cię do zdobywania każdego przełomu poprzez krew i trud. Po wielu miesiącach rozwoju Medieval 2 jest naszym najbardziej dopracowanym rozszerzeniem ery średniowiecza, oferującym wyjątkowe wrażenia bez ograniczania twojego stylu gry lub zatrzymywania twojego postępu technologicznego" Opisz z https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3444347874 Fully functional mod translation Modification: Vanilla Factions Expanded - Medieval 2 Author:Oskar Potocki, xrushha, Taranchuk, Sarg Bjornson, Oracle of Thessia Link to modify:https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3444347874 Github link: Jeżeli spolsczenie sie spodobało napisz komentarz

publishedfiledetails.title: [FS]Ye Xiao Yang: Anomaly Control
publishedfiledetails.file_description: 主要功能简介： 1. 像控制机械一样控制所有暗黑实体并指挥它们战斗。 2. 单人角色扮演模式，成长科技树与独特剧情。 https://i.imgur.com/pTRGWAT.png ◆ 单人角色扮演模式 从高维来到边缘世界的“叶小羊”将加入你的殖民地。 https://i.imgur.com/87K7l3N.png 她体内的暗黑控制核心，可以像机械控制那样，奴役并指挥异常实体。 而她的最终目标，是取代边缘世界的某个倒霉超凡智能。 请注意：她的死亡意味着殖民地摧毁，这是真正的主角模式。 特点： 1. 超长成长科技树，通过暗黑点数提升意识、身体血量、自愈能力与其他的东西。 https://i.imgur.com/SS5UE5E.png 1. 一条任务剧情线，她为什么来这里？她的目的是什么？ https://i.imgur.com/gXFr3Qa.png 1. 新增一个新结局：成为暗黑超凡智能。（这需要你完成原版异常剧情线。） https://i.imgur.com/KTCJQnR.png 4.其他更多功能...... https://i.imgur.com/pTRGWAT.png ◆ 异常实体收容与驯服 将那些曾经让你闻风丧胆的存在变为你的战力：苦痛之球、金属怪型、血肉兽、蜈蚣级清洁怪物……甚至是方尖碑！只要控制得当，它们都将听命于你。 特点： 1. 能够控制近乎所有异常实体，并指挥它们战斗，这不仅是简单的改改阵营，而是可以征召并进行手操。 https://i.imgur.com/n4hXLWV.png 1. 发挥异常的独有能力，无论是金属怪形植入还是幽魂催眠。 https://i.imgur.com/gRBkKH9.pnghttps://i.imgur.com/XSLyowI.png 1. 修正其他异常事件，矫正异常黑暗，让血雨不在具有负面buff......逐步夺取暗黑超凡的权柄。这需要很长的游玩时间 https://i.imgur.com/JBbjzRS.png 1. 生成友方巨坑 厌倦了巨坑时不时蹦出血肉兽？又一次不小心把母兽给打死了？现在不用担心了，母兽是属于我方的了，而且巨坑再也不会出现敌对生物了。你可以放心的把它作为第二基地。 https://i.imgur.com/sllLorK.png 5.其他更多功能...... https://i.imgur.com/pTRGWAT.png ◆ 新增势力 异常研究中心：一个专注异象科技的中立派系，提供异象DLC的专属商品（如灵铁、暗黑碎片等）。 净化者联盟：一个以毁灭异常为己任的敌对势力，与你势不两立。 ◆ mod平衡性： 仅叶小羊一人就价值20万银......这意味着前期你可能会遭遇暴风骤雨般的袭击。但当能力提升上来后，游戏便会变的相对轻松。这是一个前期较为困难的模组。 https://i.imgur.com/pTRGWAT.png ◆ 三位异界来客 在原版异象的最终战里添加了三位强大的克苏鲁外神投影作为boss。 最极致的数值，最极致的危险。建议做好万全准备再激活巨石最终战。 https://i.imgur.com/pTRGWAT.png ◆ 机制变更： 作为即将取代暗黑超凡智能的你，自然无法再抓捕和收容“暗黑实体”。你可以通过“异常研究收集中心”和“活铁收集中心”来收集受你控制的“暗黑实体”的研究点和灵铁，它们在异象建造栏内。“暗黑实体”们拥有的点数与灵铁写在研究文案内。 ◆ 受游戏原本人物AI代码影响，“暗黑实体”的部分控制需要额外说明： 1.如果控制一个“暗黑实体”后，友方“暗黑实体”仍尝试攻击它（索敌），则征召后再解除征召，这对刚刚控制的“暗黑实体”同样有效。 2.“血棘巨人”仅能在未受征召的情况下才会发射尖刺，征召后仅可近战攻击。 3.使用“派出幽魂”进行催眠后无法取消。幽魂将不死不休直到催眠目标为止。但是可以通过征召后，对另一个无关紧要的动物使用“催眠”来转移目标。（这是为了防止你无聊到想对友方小人使用这个技能，结果无法收场而特别做出的提示） 4.友方小人和“暗黑实体”对激活状态下的“苦痛之球”有强烈的PTSD，这导致哪怕苦痛之球变成友方了，他们距离苦痛之球过近仍然会去攻击它。此外苦痛之球仅不会对友方生物造成伤害，对建筑仍然是无差别攻击。所以你最好把它派遣的离殖民地远一点...... 5.所有友方“暗黑实体”会全图索敌攻击任何胆敢侵犯你大缘疆土的敌人。如果你不想他们去送人头，就给他们设置活动区（下方选项框→异常）， https://i.imgur.com/pTRGWAT.png ◆ 版权申明：叶小羊的角色设计已申请外观版权。是我的个人兽设。不要用作盈利性行为。——X（推特）：Veekamon 平衡性和bug： 平衡性（异常科技所需黑暗科技点，血量等数值）可能需要调整，如果有bug与平衡性建议，可以加群反馈：276212828 部分美术有使用AI。 如果你也想定制喜欢的角色的mod但找不到团队，可联系芙露蕾蒂。 制作人员表： 策划，数值，文案：叶小羊 程序：芙露蕾蒂，黄齑淡饭 数据：风轻云淡

publishedfiledetails.title: Flame Retardant Lumber
publishedfiledetails.file_description: Flame retardant lumber is a specially treated material made by processing wood, which delays combustion time compared to regular wood. It is not completely immune to fire and slightly less durable than regular wood. After completing Biofuel Refining research, it can be crafted at the BiofuelRefinery. skillRequirements Crafting(2) WoodLog(50)+Chemfuel(50)=Flame Retardant Lumber(35) ----- This is my first Workshop Mod, created without any understanding of computer languages, and everything, including English, was made with the help of a translation program.

publishedfiledetails.title: ProtossMechPurifier
publishedfiledetails.file_description: This mod add several Protoss Purifier Mechanoid to the game. Probe: Jack of All worker unit, capable of handling various tasks. Sentry: A support unit equipped with Force Field and Guardian Shield abilities. Energizer: A support unit that can deploy Chrono Beam and Guardian Shield. Sentinel: A melee fighter with Charge and Reconstruction abilities. Legionnaire: A powerful melee fighter featuring Jump, Charge, and Reconstruction. Immortal: An anti-armor mechanoid whose damage scales with enemy armor. Equipped with Hardened Shield and Reconstruction for survivability. Colossus: The ultimate war machine, wielding a Thermal Lance that melts multiple enemies and boasting Reconstruction for durability. Protoss Shield: A unique shield that defends against both melee and ranged attacks while also blocking harmful hediffs. Photon Cannon: Specialized turret, can detect cloak enemies. CE: Yes.

publishedfiledetails.title: Rimsenal Spacer + CE smart gun tweaks
publishedfiledetails.file_description: In the base Rimsenal Spacer Faction + Combat Extended setup, smart guns have better range, recoil, sights, spread, sway, reload speed, weapon handling, aiming time, and accuracy. Reworks the smart guns in Rimsenal Spacer, primarily by reducing their magazine capacity and adjusting their reload speed. They are still stronger than the "dumb" guns, but now have at least some defined trade-offs.

publishedfiledetails.title: Fungoids aren't a Hivemind!
publishedfiledetails.file_description: A patch for Vanilla Races Expanded - Fungoid. This mod removes the "Mind Coalescence" gene from the Fungoid xenotype (the gene that makes fungoid pawns share moods and suffer any mental break together) and replaces it with the vanilla "Psy-sensitive" gene. There appeared to be demand for this to be implemented and should be useful to those that do not want to deal with this aspect of the standard fungoid xenotype. You may also see a slight performance improvement in saves with many Fungoid pawns on the map as the "Mind Coalescence" gene did have a slight performance impact whenever it scanned to synchronize the moods of the Fungoid pawns. This can be loaded in an existing save, however it will only affect newly spawned Fungoid pawns.

publishedfiledetails.title: Crypto Weapons: Restored
publishedfiledetails.file_description: https://i.postimg.cc/PrtYpZ92/Details.png I’d been waiting for VQE - Cryptoforge to drop, and when it finally did, I was a little bummed to see it only included 2 of the original crypto weapons from VFE - Vikings. It's totally understandable though as the new crypto weapons have a ton of customization so adding anymore would be extremely cumbersome. But I still wanted those weapons back, so I decided to port them myself! They are fully functional with the new systems VQE - Cryptoforge has (crafting, status effects etc). That said, I didn’t bring all of them back. The axes and crossbows felt redundant, and the old shield was basically just a regular shield with nothing interesting going on. Also, these don’t have the crazy customization options the new Cryptoforge weapons have—for obvious reasons. (However they DO come with the Norse names!) However, I did revive an unused weapon that was left in the file (the Crypto Shotgun). And of course, I brought back the warcasket weapon from VFE - Pirates too. Bonus: The Mjollnir Strike Targeter returns! Technically unrelated to the crypto weapons, but it was too cool to leave behind. If it's not your thing, just use cherrypicker. As always, if you run into a bug, please leave a comment containing a hugslib log + what you were doing when it happened. (If you don't give me a hugslib log and I chop off your limbs) https://i.postimg.cc/282v4yfm/Contents.png https://i.postimg.cc/8P5KgpQq/Info-G-2-5-5.png https://i.postimg.cc/D0cGpyJr/FAQ.png Q: CE Compatible? A: Maybe? The shotgun is new but the old crypto weapons use the same defs so those could work. Q: Is this balanced? A: I like to think so but please let me know if things feel off Q: Save game compatible? A: Should be safe to add but could be dangerous to remove. https://i.postimg.cc/3rj2x9Sk/Credits.png - Smxrez (Me): Porting / Fixing things for 1.5 and making things work with VQE - Cryptoforge - OskarPotocki: All of the original textures - Zaljerem: Fixing the Mjollnir Strike Targeter

publishedfiledetails.title: 阅读加成与书架patch
publishedfiledetails.file_description: 修改阅读加成逻辑，让大容量书架更有意义 Modified reading bonus logic to make high capacity bookshelves more meaningful 封面书架来自GloomyFurniture Cover bookshelf from GloomyFurniture 原版书架的阅读加成与书架的每格填充率有关，10容量书架与100容量书架提供的加成一致，本Mod修改了其中的逻辑，具体为根据书本质量和数量来线性计算加成（最终值除4），可配置 The original bookshelf's reading bonus is related to the shelf's fill rate per compartment, with 10-capacity bookshelves providing the same bonus as 100-capacity bookshelves, this mod modifies the logic of this to calculate the bonus linearly based on the quality and quantity of the books (the final value is divisible by 4), and it is configurable 修改了以下家具mod中的书架，让书架能真正储存书籍，容量可配置： modified the Modified the bookshelves in the following furniture mod to actually store books, with configurable capacity: GloomyFurniture ： https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1558635181 Daily furniture 塔林家具: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3024562670 存档中途加入本Mod没问题，但中途移除会发生什么并不清楚，可能需要把书架里的书提前排出来避免错误，最好提前备份 It's fine to add this mod to an archive, but it's not clear what happens if you remove it, so you may need to line up the books in the bookshelf beforehand to avoid errors, so it's a good idea to back it up in advance! 翻译： deepseek / Deepl Translations : deepseek / Deepl

publishedfiledetails.title: RimKnights - Oripathy
publishedfiledetails.file_description: RimKnights - Oripathy brings the dreaded disease from the world of Arknights to Rimworld. Currently, this mod only has the disease oripathy and a few sources of infection. Current features: Oripathy - As this condition progresses, more and more crystals will grow on your colonist's body. Careful management of these symptoms will be critical for your colonists' quality of life. There is no cure for oripathy. Shattering - When an infected individual dies, their corpse becomes a new source of transmission. If left alone, the corpse will eventually explode in a cloud of originium dust, potentially infecting those nearby. Destroy the body quickly or keep it away from your healthy colonists. Originium in the environment - certain weather conditions can expose your colonists to originium, increasing the chance of contracting oripathy and speeding up its progression. Symptom managment - a weak analgesic is all you will have to manage symptoms the pain until you can purchase or manufacture enough suppresant for your colony. Precepts - With Ideology, people's opinions towards your infected colonists can range from bigotry to worship. Pandemic - Scenarios are patched to include a 5% chance for any humanoids to be Infected Compatibilities: Simple Custom Gas Framework - Allows active originium dust to linger in the air as a gas. Future plans: These may end up being standalone or modular mods Originium industries and weapons (war crime simulator ++) Catastrophes Arknights factions Terran wildlife Terran races Magic and psycasts reflavored as Arts with oripathy interactions This is my first C# based mod and I'm very excited to share this with everyone. This mod has not been playtested extensively so any suggestions in regards to it is welcome. Many thanks to the people in the RimWorld Discord server for taking the time to answer my questions and offering suggestions. GitHub

publishedfiledetails.title: No "Consume grass" Command
publishedfiledetails.file_description: When a pawn is drafted, this patch suppresses the "Consume" option in the float menu for wild plant(or any item with ingestible.foodType set as Plant). This reduces the micromanagement that happens during combat when a player right-clicks on an area with grass. When the pawn is not drafted, the float menu will behave as before. This patch was created for Dragonian but should work with any race mods that can eat plants.

publishedfiledetails.title: [Curvaceous Mechanoid]The Teddy bear [1.5]
publishedfiledetails.file_description: Is Rimworld bosses too dull for you? do you want a genuine challenge that would put you constantly on edge? From the creator of Curvaceous Underarmored Mechanoids Introducing Happi. Happi could only be fought ONCE What is a Happi you ask? The Model 188 'Happi' is a modified mechanoid companion toy. The practice of altering commercial mechanoids has become a notorious tactic in political assassinations, gaining widespread infamy since the Zartha Crisis. It is now punishable by death on 197 planets. The specific modifications to this unit remain largely unknown, though the container it carries emits unusually high energy readings. Battle call outs All Pawn in this mod have battle dialogue thank to Call out , taunting you during battle for extra emotional damage! Remember to enable animal speak in call out options otherwise she won’t be able to Multi Phase Mechanic The fight are composed of three phases https://i.imgur.com/R8kSVzO.png https://i.imgur.com/p1Xu3IU.png https://i.imgur.com/cD04Fev.png Spawning To summon Happi simply build a Mechband mimick (requires Ultra mechtech) and summon her as if any other boss mech. Cost: 1High Subcore , 55 Steel , 15 Plasteel , 2 Adv Component. https://i.imgur.com/TMluiWf.png Rewards Defeating Happi will grant you her chip allowing you to build your own version of Happi! https://i.imgur.com/hFttFXu.png Along with 700 Steel , 500 Plasteel , 15 Component , 5 Adv Component and a Persona core AI Q&A Q: CE compat? A: Yes , it's on the thumbnail Q: Callouts requirement? A: The mod can technically run without call out just ignore the errors. Q: How hard is this fight? A: Happi is designed to besiege mid-late game colonies and should be fought after getting a few centipedes and mechs Q: Any tips on defeating her? A: Pay close attention to all her attacks , and don’t let those Teddies get too close Q: Is it safe to add mid game? A: Yes! Q: Is this balanced around vanilla? A: Yes, Carefully so even! Q: Can it be played without Call outs? A: Yes , some error may pops out though Q: Aren’t you just inserting your shitty OC? A: Yes , so you can kill her! Q:Why does it look so CURVACEOUS? A: Don't you mean Fluff's Curvaceous Underarmored Mechanoids? https://i.imgur.com/HRqw0vv.gif

publishedfiledetails.title: Helmet Hoarder Great War
publishedfiledetails.file_description: This Mod includes 22 apparel items from ww1: 3 Face Masks, 2 Armors and 17 Helmets. Combat Extended (CE) is supported, but not required, and uses real world thicknesses +3mm for balancing around the simple helmet. All Helmets existed and were used historically. For more information on them, visit my sources (You will probably need to translate most pages) This is my first rimworld mod and I hope you like it just as much as I do. The Helmets are balanced around vanilla Helmets and are intended to be as step between the simple helmet and the flak helmet. They all include material color masks with accents of the material tint. If you find any Bugs, please comment them and I will try to fix them as soon as possible. Sources: German Equipment: - Stahlhelm M16,M17,M18: http://humanbonb.free.fr/indexCasqueall.html (Fre) - Stirnpanzer (Browplate), Sappenpanzer (Lobster Armor), Sappenpanzer Gesichtsmaske, Gaede Helmet: http://humanbonb.free.fr/indexProtegesfaciauxall.html (Fre) - Pickelhaube: https://www.preussen1988.de/html/Preussenerlaeuterungen/Die%20Geschichte%20der%20Pickelhaube.htm (Ger) Austro-Hungarian Equipment: - Berndorfer, Berndorfer Browplate: https://maplecreekmilitaria.com/2022/03/19/austro-hungarian-berndorfer/ (Eng) Italian Equipment: - Farina Helmet: https://www.cimeetrincee.it/elmofari.htm (Ita) - Farina Armor: https://www.cimeetrincee.it/farina.htm (Ita) French Equipment: - Adrian, French Skullcap: http://humanbonb.free.fr/indexCasquefr.html (Fre) - Adrian Browplate,Adrian Polack Visor: http://humanbonb.free.fr/indexProtegesfaciauxfr.html (Fre) British Equipment: - Brodie: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brodie_helmet (Eng) Russian Equipment: - Sohlberg Shovelsteel M17: https://maplecreekmilitaria.com/2022/03/12/russian-m17/ (Eng)

publishedfiledetails.title: EchoColony
publishedfiledetails.file_description: Have you ever wondered what your colonists think about their daily lives? Their relationships, that scar that never healed, their last breakup… or that human leather throne in the dining room? With EchoColony, you can talk to them directly. 💬 Their responses aren’t random — they reflect what they’ve lived, how they feel, and what they remember. Your colonists reply like real people. Want them to address you as a king? A god? A curious visitor? You decide. Configure their tone globally or individually. Want one to talk like a zombie? A robot? A wild-eyed lunatic from downtown? Yes — you can do that too. Make another obsessed with human leather armchairs? Yes — you can do that too. Colonists always take into account their backstory, mood, pain, relationships, and recent events when responding. They also know where everyone else is — who’s alive, who’s dead, who’s in cryosleep, who’s working as a slave, and who’s out there fighting for the colony. They recognize their children, their lovers, their enemies — even if they’re far away or long gone. If they’re grieving someone, you’ll feel it. If they’re miserable, they won’t feel like talking. If they’re elated, they might even joke. Every thought that affects their mood is considered. You can choose between two styles: • ✨ Roleplay mode: immersive, expressive replies with gestures and emotional nuance. • 🗣️ Direct mode: clear and concise, focused on conversation. Because even the quietest human-leather tanner has something to say. --------------------------------------- This is my first RimWorld mod. It’s inspired by mods like RimSaga, RimGPT, and RimDialogue. The mod uses the Google Gemini API, so you’ll need to generate your own API key and paste it into the mod settings. You can get your own key here: https://aistudio.google.com/ — just click "Get API Key" and paste it into the mod settings. All you need is a Gmail account! This mod adds a new button when selecting a colonist that lets you start a conversation with them. You can customize the tone of the conversation, delete messages, and export the full chat history. I tried to cover every possible configuration, and I’ve tested it through an entire playthrough with over 150 mods of all kinds without any issues. All feedback is welcome! RimWorld is a massive and unpredictable game, so I’ll keep improving it as more players try it and share their experiences. --------------------------------------- “Is it compatible with X mod?” I have so many mods that my game takes 10 minutes to load, and I haven’t had any problems so far. “Is it compatible with new races and xenotypes?” It should be! I did my best to make it as compatible as possible. “Is it safe to install mid-game?” That’s exactly how I tested it, in every situation I could think of — and my PC didn’t explode. “Is it safe to uninstall mid-game?” I think so. The mod doesn’t inject anything new into your game files. It only reads data from your colonists to generate conversations, so in theory, it should be safe to remove. "Why is the image in Spanish?" Oh, that's because my native language is Latin American Spanish. But the mod should work in any language — either because it detects the language you're playing in, or because you can configure your colonists to speak in whichever language you prefer. "Can I ask you something?" Hey, the mod is for talking to colonists, not to me. Just kidding! Of course you can! Feel free to tell me anything — feedback, suggestions, whatever you want. ------------------------------------------------ Every coffee helps me keep the updates coming. Thanks a ton for the support! https://imgur.com/2p03pkM.png

publishedfiledetails.title: Unknown Father
publishedfiledetails.file_description: 📌 Unknown Father ✨ "Why this mod exists" ✨ Tired of every child born to a prisoner being automatically linked to one of your colonists? This mod was made for exactly that reason. Unknown Father removes the father's identity after birth if the mother is a prisoner — leaving behind a child with no known parentage. A subtle touch of mystery for your colony's story. 🍼 During pregnancy, the last romantic partner may still appear listed as the father. However, after birth, the social tab will no longer show any paternal connection. It's a small visual detail — but for those who care about narrative consistency, it's something I'm working to eliminate completely. Once I resolve it, the mod will be updated accordingly. ✏️"Some stories are better left untold..." In the chaos of war, captivity, and survival, not every child is born with a clear lineage. Unknown Father is a subtle storytelling mod that ensures: 👶 When a prisoner gives birth, the father’s identity is hidden. 🔍 No "Father: X" message during pregnancy or after birth. 🧠 Seamless integration — zero micromanagement required. 💬 Keeps your colony’s social web mysterious and dramatic. Whether you're managing a compassionate colony or a morally grey empire, this mod adds ambiguity and realism to your narratives — without violating the vanilla flow of the game. 🛠 Compatibility ✔️ RimWorld 1.5 ✔️ Compatible with Biotech & most mods

publishedfiledetails.file_description: 这个Mod允许你使用生物技术的培育仓培育殖民者的克隆体。克隆体不受被复制者的年龄或生育能力的限制，甚至可以完整复制他们的异种。当然也可以使用变种系统使克隆体产生一些突变基因。 设置允许你自定义克隆变异的几率和范围，确定其可能影响的基因。默认设置是不产生任何变异。 还可以从被复制者中获得异种基因，并使用生物技术的基因库来编辑克隆体的基因。 兼容性 - 需要生物技术DLC - 兼容 1.5版本 - 兼容 Humanoid Alien Races Mod - 应该兼容 Questionable Ethics Enhanced Mod，虽然他们通过不同方式实现了这个Mod的某些功能。 基于Zaijerem的Biotech Cloning (Continued)制作的汉化包。 -翻译的内容可能不甚严谨，请多多包涵。如有侵权，立刻下架删除。

publishedfiledetails.title: Birth Status Handler
publishedfiledetails.file_description: 📌 Birth Status Handler Ever wondered what happens when a new life enters the world... under uncertain circumstances? Birth Status Handler adds a lore-friendly and gameplay-enhancing system that automatically assigns a newborn's status based on their mother's faction. 👶 Newborns inherit their mother's alignment: Colonist, Neutral, or Hostile. 🚨 If born to a prisoner, the child is considered a prisoner upon birth. 🧠 No micromanagement — it just works. Immersive and hands-off. ⚙️ Works seamlessly with both vanilla and modded RimWorld colonies. ✨ Adoption Still Possible The game's native adoption system remains fully functional. A child's fate may follow their mother's status — or you may choose to adopt them into your colony and give them a new future. 🔧 Compatibility ✅ RimWorld 1.5 / 1.4 / 1.3 ✅ Compatible with Biotech, Ideology, and most other mods. ✅ Safe to add mid-save — effects apply to newly born pawns. 🧪 Notes ❗ This mod does not contain graphic or disturbing content. 🧱 All logic is handled through in-game mechanics and faction systems. 🧩 Designed for immersive storytelling with minimal intrusion. 💬 Suggestions or feedback? Leave a comment! If you'd like a version tailored to your playstyle, I'd love to hear it. 🌟This mod is designed for immersive storytelling and is safe for all players.

publishedfiledetails.title: Fleshmass Regeneration
publishedfiledetails.file_description: - Required Mods - Requires Harmony and Anomaly - Description - By combining a unique dreadmeld drop and the fleshmass heart research you can implant your colonists with unmatched regeneration. This mod adds a unique drop the *incomplete fleshmass nucleus* rewarded for killing the dreadmeld. It is useless on its own but after you come across the fleshmass heart, its fleshmass nucleus and unlock its research it allows you to take advantage of the regeneration of the dreadmeld for yourself! The Medical skill required is 10 as I still wanted the Paramedic Mechanoid to be able to install it for solo colonists. - Acquisition - After unlocking *Mutation Weaponry* in Anomaly Research Under (Operations -> Add bill -> Implant fleshmass nucleus) Implanting the *incomplete fleshmass nucleus* along with a *biomutation pulser* gives the pawn the regeneration (impossible) hediff that the dreadmeld has. - Thoughts - Is it hard to get, yeah definitely! Is it harder to get than the other form of regeneration on a regular colonist, no! Is it based on getting two random events that might never appear, yep! Should I have made it easier to get, probably! Will I make it easier, maybe in the future! However I do think it is balanced and lore friendly if that counts for anything. - Notes - I have been told that this is very similar to an implant in Integrated Implants by FTL, Just to be clear I didn't even know it existed and didn't copy it on purpose so I'll see what happens. It should be compatible with Integrated Implants as their mod uses modded hediffs and this mod uses vanilla hediffs, so you could double down on the regeneration.

publishedfiledetails.title: 更多实用的材料
publishedfiledetails.file_description: 增加了更多实用的材料。包含12种建材，3种织物。 它们是由原版材料加工后得到的，您可以在在锻造、切石、熔炼、缝制的相关工作台上寻找他们的配方。 我同时增加了对应的地板。祝您玩的愉快。 【性能更好的材料】 锐钢合金：1钢铁+1化合燃料=1锐钢合金。高性能的金属材料。性能稍逊于玻璃钢。 木板：1原木=1木板。木板的性能要比未加工的原木更好。同时它的重量大幅减少。制作建造工作量减少。 镀钢木板：1钢铁+1木板=1镀钢木板。高强度的木头材料。钢铁包裹着木板，强度不错，不够漂亮。 微晶玻璃陶瓷：1石块=25微晶玻璃陶瓷。集齐了各种石砖的优点。 【良好的装饰性材料】 精致木板：2原木=1精致木板。它在韧性方面等同于普通木板，不过它更加的漂亮且昂贵。美观度可以媲美翡翠。价格上和镀金木板差不多，美观上不如镀金木板。主要用于贸易。 镀金木板：1木板+0.2黄金=1镀金木板。仿金风格的木板。和黄金一样美丽。 金钢：1钢铁+0.2黄金=1金钢。金包铁。从外观上看不出和黄金的区别。它低廉的价格在平民中很受欢迎。某些星球的居民喜欢佩戴这种材质的大金链子在脖子上。 【高强度的材料】 微晶陶瓷合金：1微晶玻璃陶瓷+1锐钢合金=1微晶陶瓷合金。它的硬度远超过了玻璃钢。 铀晶陶瓷合金：1铀晶陶瓷合金+1铀=1铀晶陶瓷合金。较高强度，几乎可以作为永固建筑的材料。 合金丝魔菇布：1锐钢合金+1魔菇布=1合金丝魔菇布。内部缝合了锐钢合金丝的魔菇布。性能优异。 合金丝超织物：1合金丝魔菇布+1超织物=1合金丝超织物。内部缝合了锐钢合金丝魔菇布的超织物。它做成的衣物能媲美金属盔甲。笨重的装甲是不再需要的了。 【廉价脆弱的耗材】 薄铁皮：1钢铁=20薄铁皮。廉价脆弱，异常锋利。作为尖刺陷阱时它很危险。 薄木板：1原木=10薄木板。强度略高于一叠纸。节省木料。易燃。 （薄铁皮和薄木板的耐久度极低，用于屋顶陷阱的支撑柱时可以迅速地制造塌陷砸伤敌人，如果是厚岩顶会造成更好的效果，同时适合简易的路障陷阱。） 碎砖骨料：1石块=125碎砖骨料。它是廉价的防火建材，比石砖节省了很多的工作量，同时不是太过于脆弱。 粘胶纤维：1原木=2粘胶纤维。原木提炼的植物纤维，产量很大，但远远不如天然纤维。可用于训练手工技能。

publishedfiledetails.title: Infection Info
publishedfiledetails.file_description: 1.5 Forked for lazycat's Infection Info 1.4 and colinfang's Infection Info 1.3 Special thanks to for the original concept and groundwork. Support Language English ChineseSimplified (简体中文) GitHub Original description Ever wondering why those nasty infections occur so often? This is a QoL mod that attempts to demystify the infection mechanism behind the scenes. It displays the real time infection chance and uncovers the influential factors. It provides an option to make the infection chance rely on the current room cleanliness instead of that at the time of tending (Default off). It highlights when the immunity gain is so slow that a pawn might die. Base Game Mechanism For Infection Some injuries might develop infections. Once a susceptible injury occurs, the game does a first pass RNG check using the base infection chance. If success, a random number is picked to determine how soon the wound will be infected. This number ranges between 6 hours to 18 hours, referred as danger period. At the scheduled time, a second RNG check is done to determine whether the infection is applied eventually. The chance here is based on a few factors e.g. tend quality, tend room cleanliness, injury severity. What Does This Mod Do It shows the infection chance breakdown in the injury tooltip. It shows how soon the injury would enter or leave the danger period. Injuries that are susceptible to infection are marked with a special color icon. - White for grace period - Yellow for danger period with a low infection risk - Red for danger period with a high infection risk It provides an option to make the infection chance rely on the current room cleanliness instead of that at the time of tending. (Default off) - This makes field tending viable as the patients benefit from resting in a clean room after battle. - No longer have to remember to clean the room just before tending. Additional Features Under unfortunate circumstances a pawn gets infected. It becomes a race against time in order to survive. This mod predicts Hediff severity when a pawn reaches full immunity, and marks the ones that could kill a pawn due to immunity gain not being fast enough. Work on other Hediffs e.g. flu as well. What Does This Mod NOT Do The default mode does not alter game mechanism. It does not modify saves. Safe to add or remove at any time. It does not reveal when exactly the infection would happen. (Visible in Dev mod already) It does not reveal ahead of time that an injury will not develop an infection if the first RNG check doesn't pass.

publishedfiledetails.title: Transcendence
publishedfiledetails.file_description: Note: If you see a bug I'm sorry. I will fix soon. Should mostly work well. Note for people who have subbed before: Detachment also slowly decreases from having comfort over 0.7 now Rimworld is a captivating game because it's the framework for good stories. It generates meaningful, memorable moments around which players can create their own stories. What is lacking in the game, and the mods, is the dimension of a higher order. The element integral to many good stories is something beyond the purely materialistic, physiological, psychological, and ideological conception of reality, beyond physical facts. Wise old man. Stoic warrior. Holy man. Even Archotechs are only constructed, and bound within the physical order, and is not related to what is eternal. It doesn't transcend reality; It's just an unusually powerful inhabitant of it. There is no magic, no transcending reality and turning into a god. It is intentional. I don't expect many people to care about this, because this mod doesn't add hot anime girls, badass weapons, magical effects, or hyper-realism. It just needs to be made, because there's no other mods. New Mechanics Detachment How detached this person is from worldly concerns, their spiritual connection with a higher order, their discipline, and will to attain a goal without regard to discomfort. People with a high sense of detachment tend to be less distressed by negative emotions, but also less elated by positive ones. They're able to bear more physical pain than the average person. It can be cultivated by meditating, creating art, solitary relaxation, and reading esoteric literature. Indulging in pleasurable food, recreational drugs, physical love, and abundance of comfort injures this higher connection. Often, even with constant dedication, it takes years for somebody to become a master. Wisdom How much life experience and practical knowledge this person has accumulated. Wisdom mainly comes naturally with age, but reading novels also give small amounts of wisdom. Wisdom affects social impact. Young people are usually unwise and have a social impact penalty. https://files.catbox.moe/69vbix.png Detachment The ethos of warrior classes, monastic monks, and mystics. Detachment is a new stat that every human pawn will have. It increases so slowly, that it will take years for someone to become a master. Good for flesh purity ideologies. Detachment is gained when a pawn Meditates (with or without Royalty dlc meditation locations) Creates Art at art bench Solitary Relaxation Read Esoteric Literature (A new book type) Detachment is lost when a pawn Too comfortable -- having comfort greater than 0.7 will slowly decrease detachment. Eats Pleasureable Food -- any food that grants a mood buff, like fine meals. Intakes Non-Medical Drugs Lovin' It's hard to increase detachment significantly unless you're trying to. Most pawns will have their detachment stay pretty low just from being comfortable, occasional drug use, or eating food. Detachment will have no effects until it reaches 30%, at which point a new Gizmo will appear for the pawn: https://files.catbox.moe/18skv1.png The first bar shows the pain reduced by detachment. When detachment is at 100%, 50% of pain will be reduced. The second bar shows mood dulling effect. Detached pawns are less swayed by pains and pleasures, and will remain in a state of calm. At 100% detachment, all mood effects will become 0. https://files.catbox.moe/ejiz61.png As a pawn becomes more Detached, it will become harder and harder for them to gain more detachment, and easier to lose it. Esoteric Literature A new book item that will increase detachment and intellectual skill. These can be from philosophical treatises, to the manuscripts of ancient mystics. Can be obtained from any traders that sells books. https://files.catbox.moe/3mrzme.png Backstory and Ideology Precept A new ideology precept that increases detachment gain. Can be added to any ideology with no meme requirements. https://files.catbox.moe/p5r07q.png Some backstories also have an initial Detachment boost. https://files.catbox.moe/4idxcf.png Wisdom A relatively simple stat compared to detachment. Higher wisdom gives a boost to social impact. The most social impact wisdom can give is +20%. As pawns age, their wisdom will increase slightly. However, a pawn at age 0 will have -1.0 wisdom, and will now suffer a social impact penalty from their negative wisdom. Their wisdom will slowly rise until at age 30, wisdom is no longer negative, and is now 0. From then on, wisdom will increase at a rate of 1.0 wisdom point per 20 years. Max wisdom (5.0) will be obtained at age 130. Each 1.0 point of wisdom gives +4% social impact. This gives old and disabled pawns a believable and meaningful benefit. Reading Novels will now also increase wisdom, although at a very slow rate. https://files.catbox.moe/9vaunj.png Note: Unfortunately, ageless pawns do not gain wisdom as they age (I did not want to implement because the game doesn't track their years of lived experience, and I would have to make it up). A fictionally coherent explanation might be that without a fear of mortality, people don't become wise. But that really is just some bogus I made up. Credits Programmed by Claude AI Bugs Please tell me any bugs you find. Very appreciative for that kind of feedback. Compatibility I have no idea. Let me know if it is incompatible with anything.

publishedfiledetails.title: KurinDX Retexture - VanillaFace OriginalTaster
publishedfiledetails.file_description: Introduction Since the birth of Kurin in v1.0, several successors have appeared. Some of them have made the textures more detailed, but of course most of them have their own unique arrangements. This MOD is one of those high-definition arrangement MODs, but the concept of this one was to make KurinDX's VanillaFace textures as close as possible to the original v1.0. Suitable for a wide range of skin tones The composition method of the KurinDX eye texture is not multiplication, so it is difficult to make it blend in with a wide range of skin tones, but I think I was able to make it blend in to a degree that does not look unnatural with any skin tone -High resolution Of course, the resolution is x512 to match DX -Color mask support Of course, it also supports the mask function used to give individuality to eye colors. Moreover, the highlights, which were the same color as the irises in the DX version, have been corrected -MAKE EYEBROW GREAT AGAIN For some reason, eyebrows were removed in DX, but now Kurin and the others have started growing eyebrows again -Can someone please tell me how to write a patch to give JITOME to a female Kurin！ JITOME is the eye texture that corresponds to LC or RC in internal data name. Currently this is only given to male Kurin or male Kimiri. Once I get some advice, I'll test it and incorporate it into this MOD -CE？ (Shuttle crash heard)

publishedfiledetails.title: Starts From Scratch
publishedfiledetails.file_description: 从零开始研究 在新游戏开始时，所有的科技和蓝图都会被遗忘，这可以显著增加游戏时间。配合“研究很困难”mod，体验会更佳。 使用指南： 需要在新游戏开始前启用此Mod，中途加入无效。如果你想在游戏中遗忘已完成的科技和获得的蓝图，可以在开发者模式中执行相应的操作。请注意，这将遗忘所有的科技和应用的蓝图。 Starting Research from Scratch When starting a new game, all technologies and blueprints will be forgotten, significantly extending game time. The experience is even better when combined with the "Hard Research" mod. Usage Guide: This mod needs to be enabled before starting a new game; it won't take effect if added mid-game. If you want to forget completed technologies and obtained blueprints during the game, you can perform the corresponding action in developer mode. Please note, this will forget all technologies and applied blueprints.

publishedfiledetails.title: No Longer Human-Warhives Faction Pack
publishedfiledetails.file_description: It's been months. I have worked myself to the bone, and an absurd amount of caffeine now runs through my veins. All so I can welcome you fine people to the first major installment of No Longer Human: No Longer Human: Warhives. This mod is a testament to how far my ambition surpasses my common sense, and a testament to what I am willing to put myself through to make my funny little creatures more immersive and fleshed out. The Warhives are a new and terrifying faction inspired mainly by the gameplay of horde shooters-their raids turn your neat little cannibalism simulator into a fight against all odds while legions of bug-creatures burn your city down with a mixture of incendiary rounds and good old "accuracy by volume". Against the insectile onslaught, you must play defensively-sending out strike teams will get them eaten alive, and hiding behind a killbox will just make the damned bugs melt your turrets into slag. Did Insectors not scratch the "alien space locust" itch? Do you have far too many hours in Destiny 2? Did Mom tell you that you already have Rimsenal at home? And most importantly, do you love democracy? Then this is just the mod for you. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ "It is true we were maggots once...but through Their hunger we were reforged. Reshaped by Their divinity-and made to feel the same gnawing. Now...yes, now...we are millions strong: and we will devour the stars." -Otnaks, Ver'htox The Oksarzj, as they call themselves, are equal parts hideous and...exceptional. No other human-derived biont can come close to their sheer number, and they rival even species like the Lobsryk in atypicality. Oksarzj sexual dimorphism is more extreme than many Earthen bird and insect species-the females are twice the size of their counterpart sex, and possess many other biological features that both the males and...most other human subspecies lack, such as corrosive bile and bright, fleshy head-frills. The cheek-frills, however, are present in all members of the species. The entire race also has a particularly worrying quality-regeneration. The Oksarzj are, in a sense, the proverbial cockroaches that survived the apocalypse. Given enough time, any Oksarzj-male or female-can regrow organs and limbs, and minor wounds will close up in mere minutes. Vivisections have revealed that the creatures have a barely-functioning, malformed respiratory system. This would explain the need for gas masks on many helmets of Oksarzj make-their warriors need a constant supply of oxygen in order to not knock themselves out in the heat of combat. Rigorous testing on captured raiding parties with incendiary weapons of various manufacture, including weapons of Oksarzj make, have also shown that Oksarzj are much more weak to fire than other human subspecies. Finding bodies for the tests was a particularly challenging task-many prisoners taken from their Houses (or "Warhives" in commoner slang for such governments) have clawed their own throats out upon capture-perhaps to preserve their honor, akin to similar practices in ancient Earthen societies? Their Houses seem to work under a caste system. These societies value strength and craftsmanship above all else, and since women are the race's stronger sex, every recorded House has been led under the absolute rule of a House Matron. Their material culture is rather interesting for a society that claims to value artifice-even their fortresses appear as piles of scrap doused in cheap red paint to the naked eye, and it's truly a wonder why more among their number haven't died from their weapons accidentally combusting. There is no such thing as a military tactician in their societies-Oksarzj "tactics" are normally some variation of "throw everything we have at our target" followed with "loot everything that isn't nailed down, and most things that are". A House's main source of income is through unrelenting raids upon everything its armies can take out without more than 80% dying in the process. As for the race's religious beliefs, well...our team has got out a few short mumbles from captive priests about a "corpse-god" and eating everything, including us "defilers". We know their belief system has a name: "Htoxteli"-an undoubtedly horrid and alien word. Interrogations will continue until we have more than ramblings to work with. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Sorry this description is rather short for such a large project (a project that I'm not really...done with, but we'll get to that in a bit) but Steam can't really handle a giant breakdown of every weapon and armor piece in the mod, and most of the lore about the Oksarzj and their warrior-houses I'm keeping secret for you to find. Anyway, this is...let's call it an early release/beta version. It's a playable project that's pretty much done, but sadly I couldn't release it complete in its entirety-real life is kind of getting in the way of modding at the moment and I don't want to wait even longer to release something that's basically complete aside from a few more guns and a "miniboss" rank. Also, it's been 3-close-to-4 months of just Warhives. I want to work on a few much, much smaller things that I've had in mind for quite a while with the very limited amount of modding time I'm going to get this next month or so. I'm most likely going to add the finishing touches to this mod in a update right after those other things. And if this sort of "trial run" of this project brings up balancing errors or niches in the enemy/weapon sandbox that aren't filled, I'll have a lot more work to do, but y'all better be damn sure I'll fix whatever. This months-long tale of one man, one rickety old PC, and an obscene amount of ambition and soda ain't done yet-so enjoy what's already been made, and I'll work from there. The design of the Oksarzj xenotype was mainly inspired by the other "famous pirate alien" I alluded to back when I released Lobsryk. I took the worst, most feral and brutal parts of the Eliksni and slapped on some frills, then dressed them up in some classic "space orc" scavenged armor and gave them weapons of a similar fashion. You can sort of tell when looking at their equipment that most of what they make is made with war-loot from destroyed settlements. You got some medieval-y stuff, some stuff that looks high-tech, and some post-apocalypse inspired stuff (i.e, completely made of scrap). Another big inspiration was, believe it or not, Norse mythology. Some tellings of the Norse creation myth say the dwarves came from maggots that crawled into Ymir's corpse after he died-so I naturally took a fantasy dwarf and mutilated it beyond recognition. I imagined what the resulting dwarf would look like when the maggots become adults....and then I made the Oksarzj. The material culture sort of came from the race design-I asked myself what an insect creature would make. As "dwarves", they'd need to make something. They'd need to take great pride in it as well, and the Eliksni were scavengers: so scavenged post-apocalypse weapons. Every weapon and piece of armor that the Oksarzj make have to first start as scrap metal looted from other settlements, and then have to be meticulously crafted by their artificer caste-everything the creatures produce signifies their glory, in a sense-from their victories in battle to their innovation and work ethic. At least, that's how the Oksarzj see it.... Oh, and I forgot to mention-Warhives releases along with the official No Longer Human modding discord! What's a modding discord, you may ask? Well, it's a magical and exhausting place where unemployed coders go and scream at each other! Here's the link, I'm constantly posting updates on projects: https://discord.gg/RVZqvDzX

publishedfiledetails.title: Vanilla Quests Expanded - Cryptoforge [Fr]
publishedfiledetails.file_description: Traduction française du mod : Vanilla Quests Expanded - Cryptoforge Dans Vanilla Quests Expanded : Cryptoforge, les joueurs se lancent dans une expédition périlleuse dans le pôle nord glacé de la planète, découvrant les restes brisés d'un vaisseau spatial disparu depuis longtemps. Ce vaisseau, connu sous le nom de Cryptoforge, aurait appartenu à une civilisation nomade utilisant des cryptoparticules. Il s'est brisé en entrant dans l'atmosphère, dispersant ses secrets dans les étendues gelées. Le voyage de votre colonie commence dans une station radar abandonnée, où d'anciens scanners révèlent les sites de crash de la poupe et de la proue du vaisseau. Chaque fragment présente ses propres dangers environnementaux et ses habitants mortels : des nids d'insectoïdes cryptofondus aux mécanoïdes dormants scellés dans une stase gelée. Au cœur de chaque épave se trouve une boîte noire contenant des données cryptées, essentielles pour localiser la dernière pièce du puzzle. Une fois les boîtes noires récupérées, la quête vous mène au cœur du vaisseau : la légendaire cryptoforge elle-même. Cet ancien établi ultratech est capable de fabriquer certains des équipements les plus puissants, notamment des crypto-haches personnalisables, des cryptobolters à longue portée et de puissantes crypto-armures. Cependant, l'activation de la cryptoforge nécessite le démarrage d'un cryptogénérateur endommagé, ce qui déclenche une course contre la montre alors que sa source de carburant instable va fondre de façon catastrophique. Au cours de l'étape finale, votre caravane doit endurer des assauts mécanoïdes incessants, maintenir la chaleur et l'énergie dans l'épave gelée et défendre vos artisans qui travaillent sous pression. Récupérez des matériaux précieux incrustés dans les restes tordus du vaisseau, étudiez des plans obscurs et gérez le moral de vos artisans dans les profondeurs de ce tombeau glacial. La forge n'offre qu'une fenêtre d'artisanat limitée : une fois que le générateur explose, l'opportunité est perdue à jamais.

publishedfiledetails.title: Spriggans, Va'ni, and Rats
publishedfiledetails.file_description: A mod that adds three new xenotypes and their factions into Rimworld. -The Spriggans- Tree people with a psychic connection to nature. Recommended for Gauranlen trees. -The Va'ni- Psychically powerful peoples with an affinity for crafting and manipulation. (Inspired by the Na'vi from Avatar) -The Rats- Rodents evolved into humanoid form due to toxic waste. They tend to be hyper aggressive and don't live very long, but make excellent miners or melee fighters. Coded by CheesyBlueNips. Created by CheesyBlueNips and Skadj. Support Cheesy and the mod here: https://patreon.com/cheesybluenips?utm_medium=unknown&utm_source=join_link&utm_campaign=creatorshare_creator&utm_content=copyLink
